DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Patient Negation Fit Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: AText that describes the reason why a patient is not fit for an operation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Satisfy a condition or restriction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Satisfy a condition or restriction.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
